rows.label: tev018301_JNK0010
rows.name: Inquire[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev018301_SEL0011
rows.name: Ask Byron about Skells.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev018301_JNK0020
rows.name: Discuss[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev018301_SEL0021
rows.name: Ask Byron about recent developments.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev018301_SEL0031
rows.name: Ask Byron about Skell fuel recovery.

rows.label: tev018301_SEL0051
rows.name: Ask Byron about the restricted hangar.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev018301_SEL0091
rows.name: Ask Byron about the black craft in the restricted hangar.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev018301_SEL0111
rows.name: Ask Byron about the Prog Ares.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev018301_SEL1021
rows.name: Ask Byron about recent developments.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev018301_MSG0001
rows.name:
BLADEs purchase their own Skells and customize them
as they see fit.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev018301_MSG0002
rows.name:
Since there's no one uniform configuration,
they all have unique maintenance needs.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev018301_MSG0003
rows.name:
When you're tinkering around with a particular Skell
all day, it's kind of hard not to fall in love with its
little quirks, you know?[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev018301_MSG0004
rows.name:
When those Skells get taken on missions, I can't help
but worry about whether they'll make it back safely.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev018301_MSG0005
rows.name:
If you ever buy a Skell, make sure to take good care
of it, okay? Don't let it get wrecked![ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev018301_MSG0010
rows.name:
Once a week, I get together with an engineer named
Alan to make small rockets in our workshop.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev018301_MSG0011
rows.name:
When they're finished, we're going to insert messages
to the other ships that we've lost contact with and send
them off into space.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev018301_MSG0012
rows.name: It's a little sentimental, I know.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev018301_MSG0013
rows.name:
But it's also a lot of fun building things when you're
motivated by hope.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev018301_MSG0018
rows.name:
The main thing to remember is that destroying enemy
appendages refills your Skell's fuel.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev018301_MSG0019
rows.name:
Even if you're outside your Skell and fighting on the
ground, the fuel will still be refilled.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev018301_MSG0020
rows.name:
...Huh? You want to know how that works?
Well, the reactor inside your Skell absorbs the special
heat that's released when an appendage is destroyed.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev018301_MSG0021
rows.name:
See, modern reactors are designed to more efficiently
utilize the diffusion of thermal energy thanâ€”
...Okay, I better stop. Even I'm getting bored now.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev018301_MSG0023
rows.name:
That's where new and experimental prototypes are
stored.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev018301_MSG0024
rows.name:
We're lucky that alien idol was the only thing that
was stolen out of there![ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev018301_MSG0025
rows.name: If they had taken or destroyed everything in there...[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev018301_MSG0026
rows.name:
well, we might have lost our trump card for our
upcoming war with the Ganglion.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev018301_MSG0031
rows.name:
There's been a parade of BLADEs gathering in front of
the restricted hangar today.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev018301_MSG0032
rows.name: The heck is going on over there?[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev018301_MSG0033
rows.name:
Don't tell me the Ganglion came back to steal
something else![ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev018301_MSG0038
rows.name:
It came flying out of the restricted hangar, straight
through the rest of the hangars, and just kept going!
I don't have any idea where it ended up.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev018301_MSG0039
rows.name: Could that mean...it was stolen by the enemy?[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev018301_MSG0040
rows.name:
That prototype was the most powerful of all the
Skells in the restricted hangar, and no exaggeration.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev018301_MSG0041
rows.name:
If they managed to steal it from us, I don't know that
we'd have any hope of winning this war...[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev018301_MSG0046
rows.name:
It was a new Skell prototype based off the model
known as the Ares.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev018301_MSG0047
rows.name:
But they don't tell factory-floor mechanics like us
anything about what makes that Ares so special.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev018301_MSG0048
rows.name:
Still, it IS the basis for a craft as exceptional as the
Prog Ares...[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev018301_MSG0049
rows.name: So that means it must be something really remarkable![ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev018301_MSG1001
rows.name:
I told you about the little "messages in bottles"
Alan and I are making as a hobby, right?[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev018301_MSG1002
rows.name:
The messages are contained inside little rockets that
we're sending to the ships we've lost contact with.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev018301_MSG1003
rows.name:
Well, another engineer has joined in to help make our
silly little dream a reality.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev018301_MSG1004
rows.name: She's a colleague of Alan's, and her name is Brenna.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev018301_MSG1005
rows.name:
She's really a great engineer. ...And so beautiful!
I can't tell you how much I've come to look forward
to our weekend rocket-building sessions![ST:wait ]
